  • Method Details

    • children

      public List<? extends AstNode> children()
      Description copied from class: AstNode
      Returns a list of all AstNode children of this node. (The List.of() and Lists.builder() methods are convenient ways to create such lists.)

      Please note that tree traversal is performed by calling this method on nodes of the AST; therefore any node not included in its parent's children() is effectively not in the AST.

      Overrides:
      children in class AstNode

    • validateType

      public void validateType() throws DataTypeException
      Description copied from class: AstNode
      Typechecks this AST node, ensuring that data types are used correctly in it. The default version does nothing; subclasses of AstNode should override this method if they have anything to do with data types. This method should only be called on a node after it has been called on all of the node's children. In other words this method should be called in a post-order traversal.
      Overrides:
      validateType in class AstNode
      Throws:
      DataTypeException - if there is a data type error involving this node

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Description copied from class: AstNode
      Returns a String representation of this node. This method is declared abstract in AstNode to force subclasses to implement it.
      Specified by:
      toString in class AstNode

    • generateCode

      public void generateCode​(CompileContext context)
      Description copied from class: Statement
      Generates JVM assembly code for this statement into the context. Requirement: the code generated here must leave the stack as it found it; anything pushed onto the stack needs to also be popped.
      Specified by:
      generateCode in class Statement
      Parameters:
      context - the context to add code to
      See Also:
      Instruction, CompileContext.addCode(Instruction)
